Award.AwardTitle: Dimension theory on large scales and its applications
Award.AbstractNarration:
The large scales dimension theory is a part of coarse geometry, a relatively new subject which studies large scale properties of metric spaces. It is a growing discipline which has some analogy with the classical dimension theory which is a part of topology, a science of small scales. Many invariants of the large scale dimension theory such as the asymptotic dimension and the macroscopic dimension proved to be useful in studying finitely generated groups and open Riemannian manifolds. Thus, the large scale dimension appears in different areas of mathematics such as topology of manifolds, group theory, differential geometry. One of the main goals of this project is to prove the Gromov Conjecture about manifolds with positive scalar curvature. Another application of this project is a further development of a dimension theoretic approach to the Novikov Higher Signature Conjecture.

The classical topology has a century long history and it is substantially developed in all directions. It became a fundamental core part of mathematics. Despite on abstractness it has many profound applications to virtually all sciences (Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Economics, etc.). The large scale version of topology and in particular the large scale analogue of dimension theory has a potential to grow in a discipline of similar weight and to bring numerous application beyond the scope of Mathematics. Thus the ideas of coarse geometry are already used in the large data mining. Clearly, a quantitative processing of overwhelming flaws of data of different kind will be more and more on demand in all activities of the mankind. Another area of application of dimension theory which is addressed in this project is studying the complexity of robot motion planning algorithms.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Large Scale Geometry has close connections with many areas of mathematics such as Topology, Geometry, Group Theory, Large Data Analysis. The consepts of dimension is one of the fundamental consepts of any branch of mathematics. In the project large scale version of dimension were considered. The most important result is a proof of Gromov's conjecture about manifolds with positive scalar curvature and abelian fundamental group. Namely it was proven that the universal covering of n-dimensional such manifold has macroscopic dimension at most n-2. We recall that positive scalr curvature manifolds are  important objects in general relativity.

Another part of the project was devoted to complexity of robot motion argorithms. Generally any robot has a very complicated configuration space with a very large dimension. Since topology of such space is always nontrivial, it impossible to have a continuous navigation algorithm for the robot. It means that the navigation algorothm has to be splitted in several peices. The topological complesity of a space is exactly the minimal number of such pieces if the space is identified with the configuration space of a robot or a mechanical system. Using the anoly between the  topological complexity theory and the classical dimension theory we established upper bounds for the former in terms of the dimension of the configuration space and ithe cohomological dimension of its fundamental group. Perhaps the most important achievent in that area which was done in the project was the computation of topological complexity of nonorientable surfaces of higher genus.
